edge: caused by rampant consumerism, corporate greed, and environmental neglect.
evacuated to space 700 years prior
left to clean up the planet
in space by the megacorporation Buy n Large (BnL) 700 years prior
remains active by salvaging parts from inactive robots
arrives and is smitten by
takes and shows to its mothership, the starliner Axiom
unprepared for the positive probe response
discovers that placing the plant in the ship's Holo-Detector will trigger a hyperjump back to Earth so that humanity can begin recolonization
blames WALL·E for the disappearance of the plant
tries to send WALL·E home in an escape pod with the plant, but witness GO-4 stowing the plant in a pod set to self-destruct
retrieves the plant just as it launches from the escape pod and survives the destruction of the pod
concludes that they must save Earth after watching EVE's recordings
electrocutes WALL·E and throws him and EVE down a garbage chute
While trying to eject EVE and WALL·E into space with the Axiom's garbage, M-O accidentally jams the airlock and saves their lives.
WALL·E is a cleaning robot located in his quarters on board the Axiom.
EVE and WALL·E are nearly ejected into space with the Axiom's garbage, but M-O inadvertently jams the airlock and saves them.
McCrea and AUTO fight for control of the Axiom.
EVE inserts the plant into the Holo-Detector, initiating the hyperjump back to Earth.
Humans and robots help in securing the plant and turn the ravaged planet into a paradise.
WALL·E's memory and personality are erased after being crushed by the Holo-Detector, but he is restored with a goodbye 'kiss' from EVE.
The Axiom arrives on Earth after the hyperjump initiated by EVE, and humans and robots begin their first steps on the planet.
The plant grows into a mighty tree beneath which WALL·E and EVE rest.
